content.description: This route can be done two different ways.  First with A MASSIVE DYNO to a two finger pocket which goes at 13 DYNO.. or you can climb the face moves if you want to avoid the dyno for a 12a/b.  The lower section is very fun powerful climbing on small holds.  The upper half isn't as good but still very fun.  Well worth the effort!
content.protection: 7 bolts to a two bolt anchor with chains
content.location: Right of Shafts Big Score 11c/d and Left of Resurrection of a Solid Gold Rock Star 11c/d

climbs.name: Tear the Roof Off the Suckka

content.description: Another Great Hot Lixx line! Easy climbing up the slab leads to powerful pulls on the roof above.  Nice rock!
content.location: Over on the right on the main section of Hot Lixx wall, between Egg McMuffin and 1815.

content.description: Another Vertical face to rugs out a small roof. This route is fun and worth doing, although if I were at Tensleep for my first time I'd pass this on and head to World Domination, Munitions, Superratic, or Slavery. That said if you are a ten climber you will be somewhat limited at Ten Sleep and this will be a great route!
content.location: This is the route to the left of Teenage Ronald Mcdonald.

content.description: The leftmost line on the Hot Lixx wall which features some great dynamic throws between big jugs. Stick clip the high first bolt and set up for the initial (longest) huck--Huey, "Score the first one or go home"...Excellent swooping moves from pockets to the obligatory Hot Lixx bulge move and thinner finish.
content.location: Leftmost line on Hot Lixx Family Fun Center. First bolt is a ways up. The route immediately to the right (Turbo-tronic Dyno Master) usually has a quicklink hanging from the first bolt.

climbs.name: Resurrection of a Solid Gold Rock Star

content.description: Starts out climbing a steep smooth face with nice pockets to a rest below an overhang.  Pull the overhang and climb a little higher to the anchor.
content.location: Starts just to the left of a disappering crack/seam.

content.description: A nice long route with several steep crux sections.  One of the few good routes at this grade.
content.location: Starts on the far right side of the wall off a rock ledge with a small cave behind it.  Climbs the arete just to the left of this stance.

climbs.name: Lil smokey goes to the mondo

content.description: Small holds to start and finishes on jugs.
content.location: The far right side of the Hot Lixxx Family Fun Center.

climbs.name: I was a Teen Age Ronald McDonald

content.description: Awesome route starting with tricky pocket pulling on the steep slab up to a couple burly moves through the steep bulge on jugs...too fun!!
content.location: In the very center of the wall there is a bit of a crack system, Ronald is the second line to the right.

content.description: This route takes the faint grey streak on the right side of the wall. Start on orange colored stone for 2 bolts to the roof. Cruxy, steeper climbing for the next few bolts leads to an easier finish in the grey streak. The route may be a bit sharp in spots.
content.location: Between 'Tear the roof off the Sucka' and 'Orange Likin Delight' at Hot Lixxx

content.description: Another fun Hot Lixx climb, similar in character to all the others. Hard start, thinnish slab with excellent pockets, hard roof tug, more fun pockets to the anchor. A bit sharp? Not as memorable as Shaft's or Ressurection IMO.

Nice line, definitely worth doing if you are at the fun center.   A relatively easy cruise up to the roof is sort of uneventful, but then there are some excellent long moves leading up and through the roof.  That long move... just reach, and keep reaching...

Cool!
content.location: 2 routes to the right of Teenage Ronald McDonald.
